subject: Re: [junit] No assertEquals(double, double)?
msgSnippet: Yes it should help. It also should help in original probem. ... From: Lothar Kimmeringer  To:  Sent: Sunday, May
messageBody:
Yes it should help. It also should help in original probem.
----- Original Message -----
From: "Lothar Kimmeringer" <junit@...>
To: <junit@yahoogroups.com>
Sent: Sunday, May 12, 2002 2:03 AM
Subject: Re: [junit] No assertEquals(double, double)?


> On Sun, 12 May 2002 01:17:47 +0300, Alexander Zynevich wrote:
>
> >for example max(-0.0,+0.0) should return +0.0 if I test my own realizaton
of
> >max I will want to distinguish them :)
>
> I haven't tested it right now, but shouldn't
>
> assertEquals("check -0 and +0", new Double(-0d), new Double(0d));
>
> do the trick?
>
>
> Regards, Lothar
>
> --
> Lothar Kimmeringer E-Mail: lothar@...
